page.title: 16HOME LIFE 3
page.content: I live on my own in one of the cottages in the main street of Carrington. I am widowed. I can't walk without the aid of my zimmer and my eyesight is very bad. I have a homehelp who comes each day at 9 o'clock. First she makes my breakfast and then helps me out of bed. While I eat my breakfast she kindles my fire. My homehelp has to do most of my housework such as, dusting, hoovering, washing and ironing. She is only able to stay for 2 hours each day as she has more houses to visit. A grocers van from Gorebridge brings messages to my door every Friday, as there are no local shops. During the day I pass my time reading, watching TV and knitting.
